{"id":1114022304,"question_id":2751,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"6 months, 1 week","timestamp":1701916361,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1114022304/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Sliding Subarray Beauty","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\n    public int[] getSubarrayBeauty(int[] nums, int k, int x) {\n        int len = nums.length;\n\n        int[] res = new int[len-k+1];\n\n        PriorityQueue<Integer> pq1 = new PriorityQueue<>(\n            (a,b) -> b-a\n        );\n        PriorityQueue<Integer> pq2 = new PriorityQueue<>();\n\n        int st =0;\n        for(int ed=0; ed<len; ed++){\n\n            if(pq1.size()<x)\n                pq1.offer(nums[ed]);\n            else{\n\n                if(pq1.peek()>nums[ed]){\n                    pq2.offer(pq1.poll());\n                    pq1.offer(nums[ed]);\n                }else{\n                    pq2.offer(nums[ed]);\n                }\n            }\n\n            if(ed<k-1) continue;\n\n            if(pq1.size()==x && pq1.peek()<0){\n                res[st] = pq1.peek();\n            }\n\n            if(nums[st]>pq1.peek()){\n                pq2.remove(nums[st]);\n            }else{\n                pq1.remove(nums[st]);\n            }\n            st++;\n\n\n        }\n\n        return res;\n\n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"sliding-subarray-beauty","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
